attachments.title: Google confirms next Android version won’t use Oracle’s proprietary Java APIs
attachments.text: Google is replacing the Java application programming interfaces (APIs) in Android with OpenJDK, the open source version of Oracle's Java Development Kit (JDK). The news first came by a "mysterious Android codebase commit" from last month submitted to Hacker News. Google confirmed to VentureBeat that Android N will rely solely on OpenJDK.
attachments.fallback: VentureBeat: Google confirms next Android version won’t use Oracle’s proprietary Java APIs

text: Oh cool. It finally makes sense as to why they hired the ENTIRE java team back before oracle snatched up Sun.
